text.p: The following are the main reports in Estonia's newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- A new school year begins in Estonia today.
- The Labour Party will back former Communist leader Vaino Viljas for president in the September 20 election.
- Kuressaare is the first town in Estonia to place video cameras on the main streets to help police keep law and order.
- Leaders of Estline reject allegations by Meyers shipping yard that the shipping firm's failure to carry out urgent repairs was the reason for the sinking of the ferry Estonia.
- The Bank of Estonia will confirm the merger of Savings Bank and Industrial Bank today.
